Pre-Game Insights: Bavuma-led Proteas team is flying high with confidence coming into this match, as they defeated defending champion England in their previous fixture by 229 runs.
South Africa have scored 300-plus every time they have batted first in this World Cup, with Heinrich Klaasen and Marco Jansen providing a devastating example at the Wankhede.

South Africa are flying high after the 229-run thrashing they handed England. They have the highest net-run rate among all 10 teams in this World Cup, and a victory against Bangladesh will propel them to the second spot.
Bangladesh, on the other hand, are in the bottom half of the points table and are in dire need of stringing together some victories so that their journey doesn't come to an early end.
Their batting has been the main letdown, especially their tendency to suffer collapses and not capitalise on solid platforms.
The South African batters have been in roaring form, with telling contributions all through the batting order.
South Africa currently ranks third for most wickets taken by teams in the 2023 World Cup.
Head-to-Head: In 24 ODI played, South Africa won 18 matches while Bangladesh won 6 matches.

Players to watch out for: South Africa: Quinton de Kock, Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, David Miller, Heinrich Klaasen. Bangladesh: Litton Das, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Shakib Al Hasan, Mehidy Hasan Miraz.
What to expect: Plenty of runs, with the pitch expected to aid the batters as it has so often done, and plenty of heat too with a maximum of 37 degree Celsius being forecast for the afternoon.

Probable XIs: South Africa (SA): Quinton de Kock (WK), Temba Bavuma (C), Rassie van der Dussen, Aiden Markram, Heinrich Klaasen, David Miller, Marco Jansen, Kagiso Rabada, Keshav Maharaj, Lungi Ngidi, Gerald Coetzee. Bangladesh (BAN): Litton Das, Tanzid Hasan, Najmul Hossain Shanto, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, Shakib al Hasan (C), Mushfiqur Rahim (WK), Mahmudullah, Nasum Ahmed, Hasan Mahmud, Mustafizur Rahman, Shoriful Islam.
Pitch Report: Mumbai's Wankhede Stadium pitch has been known to be a batting-friendly track. The team winning the toss should bat first.
Weather Report: There is no probability of rain. It will be a warm day with humidity prevailing throughout the match.
SA vs BAN, Head to Head: In the 24 matches played between these 2 teams, Bangladesh do not have a good record against South Africa.
Team news: South Africa: Bavuma, who missed the game against England on Saturday with an upset stomach, is likely to return at the expense of Hendricks.
Bangladesh: A shoulder injury will keep Taskin Ahmed on the sidelines for a while longer. Bangladesh though are hoping that Shakib Al Hasan returns to full fitness.
Tactics & strategy: South Africa: Same old same old: blow them away with the bat, make do with the ball.

Tactics & strategy: Bangladesh: De Kock has had a couple of low scores after starting off with two centuries. Bangladesh will be hoping to take advantage of that through the trio of Mustafizur Rahman, Shakib and Mehidy.

What they said? Marco Jansen: 'I enjoy scoring runs more than taking wickets; there's not so much running involved. I just love batting. Whenever I bat, it gives me more joy. Bowling is more hard work. It's nicer seeing a ball fly 80 metres off your own bat than your bowling.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: This will be South Africa's first ODI clash against Bangladesh in Asia since 2015, when they lost a three-match series 1-2.
The two teams have a 2-2 head to head record in the World Cup, with Bangladesh winning in 2019.
The Wankhede has been a favourite hunting ground for South Africa, who posted 438 against India back in 2015 before posting the highest total by any team in an ODI against England a few days back.
This will be Bangladesh's first match at the Wankhede Stadium since 1998 and also only their second game at this venue.
